SETS.LaTeX: \text{Let } i \in \{X, Y, Z\} \text{ represent GoodsX, GoodsY, and GoodsZ respectively.}

VARIABLES.name: y_X
VARIABLES.description: Binary variable indicating whether GoodsX is produced (1) or not (0)

VARIABLES.name: y_Y
VARIABLES.description: Binary variable indicating whether GoodsY is produced (1) or not (0)

VARIABLES.name: y_Z
VARIABLES.description: Binary variable indicating whether GoodsZ is produced (1) or not (0)

VARIABLES.name: x_X
VARIABLES.description: Quantity of Trucks allocated for GoodsX

VARIABLES.name: x_Y
VARIABLES.description: Quantity of Trucks allocated for GoodsY

VARIABLES.name: x_Z
VARIABLES.description: Quantity of Trucks allocated for GoodsZ

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_X
PARAMETERS.description: Initial cost per truck for GoodsX

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_Y
PARAMETERS.description: Initial cost per truck for GoodsY

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_Z
PARAMETERS.description: Initial cost per truck for GoodsZ

PARAMETERS.name: Total_Trucks_Available
PARAMETERS.description: Total number of trucks available for allocation

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_Reduction_X
PARAMETERS.description: Cost reduction per $100 invested in optimization for GoodsX

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_Reduction_Y
PARAMETERS.description: Cost reduction per $100 invested in optimization for GoodsY

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_Reduction_Z
PARAMETERS.description: Cost reduction per $100 invested in optimization for GoodsZ

OBJECTIVE.query: minimize the total delivery cost for all goods
OBJECTIVE.LaTeX: \min \left( P_X x_X + P_Y x_Y + P_Z x_Z \right)

CONSTRAINTS.name: Must allocate at least 10 trucks for GoodsX
Must allocate at least 15 trucks for GoodsY
Total number of trucks allocated for GoodsZ must not exceed 25 units
